p: In this work, Salvia officinalis (Lamiaceae) is chosen for its acaricidal effect on the Varroa destructor, parasite of Apis mellifera ssp. Intermissa, in comparison with Apivar, which is a commercial chemical product frequently used in Algeria. Our goal is to study the acaricidal activity of its essential oil as a biological alternative to the biopesticide usually practiced in Algeria.
